title: Developing Speech Processing Pipelines for Police Accountability. (arXiv:2306.06086v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: Police body-worn cameras have the potential to improve accountability and transparency in policing. Yet in practice, they result in millions of hours of footage that is never reviewed. We investigate the potential of large pre-trained speech models for facilitating reviews, focusing on ASR and officer speech detection in footage from traffic stops. Our proposed pipeline includes training data alignment and filtering, fine-tuning with resource constraints, and combining officer speech detection with ASR for a fully automated approach. We find that (1) fine-tuning strongly improves ASR performance on officer speech (WER=12-13%), (2) ASR on officer speech is much more accurate than on community member speech (WER=43.55-49.07%), (3) domain-specific tasks like officer speech detection and diarization remain challenging. Our work offers practical applications for reviewing body camera footage and general guidance for adapting pre-trained speech models to noisy multi-speaker domains.

translated_title: 发展用于警察问责的语音处理流水线
translated_abstract: 警用身体佩戴摄像头具有提高警务透明度和问责的潜力。然而，在实践中，它们会产生数百万小时的未被审查的录音数据。我们探讨了大规模预训练语音模型在促进审查方面的潜力，重点关注交通站点录音中的语音识别和警员讲话检测。我们提出的流水线包括数据对齐和过滤、受资源限制的微调，以及将警员讲话检测与ASR相结合，实现完全自动化的方法。我们发现(1)微调大大提高了警员讲话ASR的性能(WER=12-13%)，(2)警员讲话的ASR比社区成员的ASR更准确(WER=43.55-49.07%)，(3)像警员讲话检测和日记化这样的特定领域任务仍然具有挑战性。我们的工作为审查身体摄像头录音提供了实际应用，并为适应嘈杂的多音箱领域的预训练语音模型提供了一般指导。
tldr: 本文探究了大规模预训练语音模型在促进警用身体佩戴摄像头录音数据审查方面的应用，提出了一套包括数据对齐和过滤、微调以及警员讲话检测与ASR相结合的流水线方法。实验结果表明微调可以大大提高警员讲话ASR的性能，而警员讲话的ASR比社区成员的更准确，然而像警员讲话检测和日记化这样的特定任务仍然具有挑战性。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the potential of large pre-trained speech models for police body-camera footage reviews, proposing a pipeline method that includes data alignment and filtering, fine-tuning, and combining officer speech detection with ASR. The experiment results show that fine-tuning significantly improves ASR performance on officer speech and that officer speech ASR is more accurate than on community member speech, while domain-specific tasks such as officer speech detection and diarization remain challenging.
